header.title: ESOTERIC EXTENSION OF TAROT TO DEVELOP SUPERSENSORY POWERS

central_thesis: The development of supersensory powers and spiritual evolution is achieved through understanding and consciously engaging with the 'testing and trying' inherent in everyday life as a direct dealing of the Divine with one's soul, fostering continuous conscious contact with the Higher Self.

structure_content.chapter_title: LESSON 39: Transcriptions from Ann Davies' Class Lectures
structure_content.summary: This lesson, based on Tarot Key 14 (Temperance), explores the nature of tests and trials as a constant aspect of life, not just significant events. It posits that human consciousness often turns to God only during major crises, overlooking the cumulative impact of 'little annoyances.' The text emphasizes the importance of transmuting these everyday challenges by viewing them as divine interactions. It introduces the concept of the 'vital soul' and the 'Higher Soul' (angelic Higher Self), which works through the personality. The core teaching is to maintain conscious contact with this Higher Self, recognizing that the personality is a projection of divine consciousness. This continuous contact, even when unconscious, is the basis of being alive. The lesson contrasts the scientific method of testing hypotheses with occult testing, which involves developing supersensory powers through consistent contact with one's divine source. It asserts that such contact already exists and is the foundation of our being. The text details personal experiences of psychic attack and the correct, loving response required for spiritual advancement. It clarifies that anger is a human emotion, not inherently evil, but the abiding attitude of the heart is paramount. The ultimate test is to react correctly to all circumstances, trusting the guidance of the Divine Self without proof, treating life itself as a laboratory for spiritual growth.

key_concepts.definition: The constant process of life where one's reactions to situations, both big and small, reveal the level of one's spiritual development and offer opportunities for growth. It is about how one reacts in any given situation.

The angelic, divine aspect of an individual, referred to as the 'Higher Soul' or 'Holy Guardian Angel.' It is described as a part of the union of God, a continuous and conscious divinity, and the source of the personality's existence and guidance.

The vehicle through which the Higher Self operates, comprised of the 'vital soul' (animal soul) and other elements. It is the part of us that experiences the tests and trials of life and requires transmutation.

The state of being in constant, conscious union with one's divine source, even when the personality is unaware. This contact is presented as the foundation of life and the key to developing supersensory powers.

The process of transforming negative or undeveloped aspects of the personality, particularly through overcoming reactions to 'annoyances' and negative experiences, by viewing them as divine workings and responding with love and acceptance.

The symbolic representation of the principles discussed in the lesson, involving the blending of the animal nature (lion) and the spiritual/intellectual nature (eagle) under divine guidance (the angel), representing balance, moderation, and transmutation.

practical_system.description: The practical system focuses on cultivating a conscious, continuous connection with the Higher Self (Holy Guardian Angel) through a reframing of life's events. Instead of reacting negatively to 'tests and trials,' the practitioner is instructed to view them as specific dealings of God with their soul, opportunities for transmutation. This involves actively recognizing the presence of the Higher Self in all circumstances, assuming its guidance, and responding with love and acceptance, even in the face of attack or adversity. The goal is to achieve a state where the personality acts as a perfect instrument of the Divine, operating from a place of inner certainty and faith, thus naturally manifesting supersensory awareness and control.
tools: Tarot Key 14 (Temperance) as a symbolic representation and visualization aid.
Inner consciousness and faith as the primary tools for perceiving and interacting with the Higher Self.
Life itself as the laboratory for practicing and testing these principles.
rituals: Viewing every circumstance as a particular dealing of God with one's soul.
Consciously practicing the presence of God/Higher Self in everyday activities (e.g., typing, gardening).
Responding to perceived attacks or difficulties with love, help, and healing instead of hatred or resistance.
Affirming the presence and guidance of the Holy Guardian Angel and acting as if this were true.
Visualizing the symbolism of Tarot Key 14 (Temperance) to integrate the concepts of balance and transmutation.

relevant_quotes.text: Therefore, tests and trials have to do with how we react in any given situation, be it little or big. Sometimes we are more tested and tried by little problems than by big ones.
Begin to say, "I will look upon every circumstance of my life as a particular dealing of God with my soul." Every circumstance! Not a selected few.
The personality is a continuation or projection of your Higher Self, which is a direct ray of the sun, the All, God.

You will never have true supersensory powers until you learn how to work with the ideas that we are discussing, the power of keeping in continuous contact with your source, keeping that contact consciously, to make it a living and daily conscious reality to you.

When you know that you are being tested and tried, you still have a problem somewhere in your nature that is being worked on and refined. When you go through certain events without realizing that they were tests, you passed.
Instead of hatred, I sent love and help and healing to the attacker, day and night, waves of love from my heart.

What is it, then, which has to be tested and tried? It is to have the proper reaction to whatever happens, to know one's self to be guided by the Divine Self even when there is no proof; to have that much faith.

Practice remembering it! Bring it to your consciousness. Walk in that Self. No matter what happens, say to yourself, "This is God living me. I will look upon every circumstance of my life as a particular dealing of God with my soul. Each experience is an indication that God is growing my personality. I am forever secure. I am forever safe, a resident in the heavens because the Divine One holds me and enfolds me in a love that grows me through problems that are no problems, only challenges that spur my evolution."

Blessed are they who will see that whatever happens has happened under the holy and loving guidance of the divine Guardian Angel, no matter how bad it seems, no matter how evil it has seemed in terms of others or yourself. It is part of the refiner's process, making gold out of lead.

critical_analysis.relevance: This text is highly relevant to practitioners of Western Esotericism, particularly those interested in spiritual development, the cultivation of psychic abilities, and integrating occult principles into daily life. It bridges esoteric concepts with practical psychological and spiritual challenges, offering a framework for understanding and navigating life's difficulties as opportunities for growth. The emphasis on the Higher Self and continuous divine contact aligns with Hermetic and Thelemic ideals, while the practical application of transforming reactions echoes principles found in various magical traditions. The use of Tarot Key 14 (Temperance) as a symbolic anchor grounds the teachings in a well-established esoteric tool.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary audience is students and practitioners of esoteric and occult disciplines, especially those engaged with Tarot, meditation, and the development of inner consciousness. It is also relevant for individuals seeking a deeper spiritual understanding of life's challenges and a practical method for personal transformation and the cultivation of supersensory abilities. Those familiar with Ann Davies' work or similar teachings on the Higher Self and divine guidance would find this particularly resonant.
